}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== It was sold as the EP-MS150N (black) and EP-MS150NW (white). :There is no label on this device.
The manufacturer of the device is presumed to be '''Haoliyuan (Shenzhen) Electronic'''. :It may have been released in late 2009 / early 2010 (or thereabouts).
The chipsets used for this device will likely vary. :Newer devices may use RTL8188CUS, RT5370, or possibly MT7601U. "WU8188" is silkscreened on the adapter's board in the images shown below.
===Information from the vendor=== '''Receiver Sensitivity''' (typical) *-68dBm @ 10% PER - 54M (11g) *-88dBm @ 10% PER - 6M (11g) *-85dBm @ 8% PER - 11M (11b) *-90dBm @ 8% PER - 1M (11b) *-105dBm @ 8% PER - 256K (11b)
==Links of Interest== :[http://www.szedup.com/product-item/wireless-usb-adapter-5dbi-antenna/#tab-id-2 Product page] (EP-MS150N v2) *[[EDUP EP-MS150N(W)]] v1 - [[Realtek]] RTL8188CUS • [http://www.szedup.com/show.aspx?id=1695 PPage (id=1695 old)] *[[EDUP EP-MS150NW v2]] (rev 0101) - [[Ralink]] RT5370 • [http://www.szedup.com/show.aspx?id=1754 PPage (id=1754 old)]
